document.discussion_title: Trimble Navigation Limited (TRMB) Given “Buy” Rating at Oppenheimer
document.topic_text: Tweet Trimble Navigation Limited (NASDAQ:TRMB) ‘s stock had its “buy” rating restated by analysts at Oppenheimer in a research note issued on Monday, MarketBeat reports. Trimble Navigation Limited ( NASDAQ:TRMB ) traded down 1.723% during mid-day trading on Monday, hitting $25.375. 453,507 shares of the stock traded hands. The stock’s 50 day moving average is $24.97 and its 200-day moving average is $21.96. The company has a market cap of $6.37 billion and a price-to-earnings ratio of 53.989. Trimble Navigation Limited has a 12 month low of $15.90 and a 12 month high of $26.36. Trimble Navigation Limited (NASDAQ:TRMB) last posted its earnings results on Tuesday, February 9th. The company reported $0.27 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, beating the Zacks’ consensus estimate of $0.24 by $0.03. The business earned $559.70 million during the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $544.36 million. During the same quarter last year, the firm earned $0.29 earnings per share. Trimble Navigation Limited’s revenue was down .7% compared to the same quarter last year. On average, equities research analysts anticipate that Trimble Navigation Limited will post $1.26 EPS for the current year. Other hedge funds have recently made changes to their positions in the company. KBC Group increased its stake in shares of Trimble Navigation Limited by 1.1% in the third quarter. KBC Group now owns 68,231 shares of the company’s stock worth $1,120,000 after buying an additional 725 shares in the last quarter. Eagle Asset Management increased its stake in shares of Trimble Navigation Limited by 94.7% in the third quarter. Eagle Asset Management now owns 265,436 shares of the company’s stock worth $4,358,000 after buying an additional 129,097 shares in the last quarter. Janus Capital Management increased its stake in shares of Trimble Navigation Limited by 14,306.3% in the third quarter. Janus Capital Management now owns 2,109,516 shares of the company’s stock worth $34,639,000 after buying an additional 2,094,873 shares in the last quarter. Fourth Swedish National Pension Fund increased its stake in shares of Trimble Navigation Limited by 3.2% in the fourth quarter. Fourth Swedish National Pension Fund now owns 72,868 shares of the company’s stock worth $1,563,000 after buying an additional 2,257 shares in the last quarter. Finally, Nordea Investment Management AB increased its stake in shares of Trimble Navigation Limited by 64.7% in the fourth quarter. Nordea Investment Management AB now owns 85,079 shares of the company’s stock worth $1,825,000 after buying an additional 33,437 shares in the last quarter. In related news, CFO Francois Delepine sold 27,063 shares of the stock in a transaction that occurred on Friday, February 12th. The shares were sold at an average price of $21.26, for a total value of $575,359.38. Following the sale, the chief financial officer now directly owns 1 shares in the company, valued at approximately $21.26. The sale was disclosed in a filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission, which is accessible through this hyperlink . Also, CEO Steven W. Berglund sold 150,000 shares of the stock in a transaction that occurred on Tuesday, March 1st. The shares were sold at an average price of $23.99, for a total transaction of $3,598,500.00. Following the completion of the sale, the chief executive officer now owns 82,089 shares in the company, valued at $1,969,315.11. The disclosure for this sale can be found here . A number of other analysts have also recently issued reports on TRMB. MKM Partners reiterated a “hold” rating and issued a $21.00 target price (up from $20.00) on shares of Trimble Navigation Limited in a research note on Monday, February 1st. Piper Jaffray reiterated a “buy” rating on shares of Trimble Navigation Limited in a research note on Sunday, December 27th. JPMorgan Chase & Co. reduced their target price on shares of Trimble Navigation Limited from $25.00 to $24.00 and set an “overweight” rating for the company in a research note on Wednesday, February 10th. Wedbush reiterated an “outperform” rating and issued a $28.00 target price on shares of Trimble Navigation Limited in a research note on Thursday, February 11th. Finally, Needham & Company LLC upgraded shares of Trimble Navigation Limited from a “hold” rating to a “buy” rating and set a $24.00 target price for the company in a research note on Wednesday, February 10th. Five equities research analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating, six have given a buy rating and one has given a strong buy rating to the company’s stock. The stock has a consensus rating of “Buy” and a consensus target price of $24.91. Trimble Navigation Limited is a provider of technology solutions for professionals and field mobile workers. The Company operates through four segments: Engineering and Construction, Field Solutions, Mobile Solutions and Advanced Devices. The Engineering and Construction segment provides heavy civil construction, building construction and geospatial solutions. //www.americanbankingnews.com/2016/04/25/trimble-navigation-limited-trmb-given-buy-rating-at-oppenheimer/ Trimble Navigation Limited Trimble Navigation Limited
